Answer: \begin{itemize} \item Compute the greatest integer less than $x$ (this is the floor function). \item Subtract $19$ from that number. \item Divide that number by $19$. \item Add the original number (the integer part) to the quotient (the fractional part). \item Subtract $1$ from that number. \end{itemize} Answer: Let $a = \lfloor x \rfloor$, $b = \lfloor \frac{x}{19} \rfloor$, $c = \lfloor \frac{x}{19} \rfloor - 1$.
